title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Zhao Wei, a popular actress turned business mogul, was mysteriously scrubbed from the Chinese internet. Which of these films did she direct?

A. "Farewell My Concubine"

B. "In the Mood for Love"

C. "So Young"

D. "Yi Yi"

---

2. Who agreed to pay $12 billion to acquire Mailchimp?

A. Intuit

B. Salesforce

C. Oracle

D. Chiquita

---

3. Median household income in the U.S. fell 2.9% last year -- to what level?

A. $47,500

B. $67,500

C. $87,500

D. $107,500

---

4. Twenty-six million pounds of Alaskan fish, bound for the lower 48, are stuck in Canada. Where?

A. New Brunswick

B. Newfoundland

C. Nova Scotia

D. Nunavut

---

5. The World Bank canceled an important report after an investigation concluded that senior bank management pressured staff to alter data. What was the aim?

A. To burnish the creditworthiness of Greece

B. To make China look better in the bank's business environment rankings

C. To stave off default by Argentina

D. To prop up the U.S. dollar

---

6. En route to college, the young George Will picked up a newspaper and read a columnist who inspired him. Name that pundit.

A. John Peter Zenger

B. Dorothy Thompson

C. H.L. Mencken

D. Murray Kempton

---

7. What in the world are "dark stores?"

A. Sovereign reserves of vital darkness stored up to forestall shortages

B. Small, hyperlocal warehouses facilitating rapid delivery

C. Empty shops in central business districts

D. Places where dark stars can shop in peace

---

8. Turkeys were in the news. Why?

A. Some people are treating Covid with a turkey hormone.

B. Chain stores have been stocking up well in advance of Thanksgiving.

C. A poultry wasting disease has sent prices soaring.

D. A massive frozen turkey spill tied up rush hour in Los Angeles.

---

ANSWERS

1. C

2. A

3. B

4. A

5. B

6. D

7. B

8. B
